name: Hotel Marlowe - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 5 days at the Marlowe on our way back from Jamaica to Paris. It was not our first time in the Boston-Cambridge area; I come there frequently for work. The Marlowe is too posh, really cheesy and expensive for its quality. Rooms are confortable but the decoration is just cheesy and heavy, unless you like leopard bathrobres, fur blankets and dark colours everywhere. The service is not up to the image they want to sell: on a Sunday night someone was passing the vacum-cleaner at 9pm. We had to ask for a coffee maker since there is none in the room and when they did give one to us, they just left it over the sink in the bathroom. No one helped us carry our luggage to the taxi and, when we checked out, we had to go get a taxi ourselves since no one at the front desk could help us. We paid $60 for two average sandwiches and desserts; just outrageously expensive. Yes, the hotel is located close to the mall and not far from the Technology Museum or the T stop but, other than that, it is really in the middle of nowhere. The Marlowe sells itself
reviews.title: Pricey for what you get

reviews.text: as a high-class, 5 stars hotel; well, they should go to Europe or Asia and see what a REAL luxury hotel is. For me, it is a basic 3 stars hotel with a layer of fake luxury on top of it.
reviews.title: Too posh, not enough focus on guests real needs

likes.disliked: — Too expensive, poor air quality, uncomfortable beds and pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marlowe on a 2-week business trip. Posh American hotel chain, but not recommended for long stays. The pluses were the superb staff - very well mannered, helpful and attentive. However, Cambridge along with the hotel is Extremely Expensive. For example, $25 for a cup of tea ordered via room service! Albiet this was ordered at 4am due to jet lag and because no in-room tea making facilities are provided, only coffee makers, room service was the only option. The "executive" gym is tiny - too small for the number of guests wanting to use it not to mention the workout required to find it. No pool or spa amenties, which would have been a nice plus for what is deemed a 5-star hotel. Bedroom very spacious with great views of the Charles River, however felt stifled by the constant air conditioning. The weather was quite mild, and it would have been lovely to get some fresh air by opening a window. But all hotels and office blocks in Cambridge seem to be airtight. What a waste of energy... and in frankly unhealthy.
reviews.title: Another outstanding stay at a Kimpton Hotel!
Another Great Boutique Hotel ... Boston-area, in Cambridge
reviews.text: Surprisingly for an American hotel, the bed was really uncomfortable as were the pillows. On the plus side, the hotel manager did go out and buy me a couple of pillows - big extra marks for that - but unfortunately he misunderstood my requirements and bought the wrong types of pillows. What did Churchill say - two countries seperated by the same language? So eventually, I went out and bought my own and took back to the UK.
Net experience: A super hotel if staying only 2-3 nights, but no more. I've stayed at better in the Kimpton group.
reviews.title: Wonderful, Unique and Reasonable Prices on All

likes.liked: — Uniqueness of most everything and the reasonableness of its prices
likes.disliked: — I would have liked the breakfast buffet to offer a bit more food options

reviews.title: Best Valentines/Blizzard Ever!!
reviews.text: We have been to the Marlowe before and it was fantastic then, but this time around, we did a little Valentines get away weekend and OH MY GOODNESS, IT WAS FANTASTIC!! When we arrived, I found chocolate covered strawberries, the most fantastic bottle of wine, and by far the best arrangement of flowers I have even seen. Yes, this was all the idea of the love of my life, so most credit has to be given to him, but it wouldn't have been possible without the help of Steve, the concierge. Friday we flew in, checked in and enjoyed the wine and berrys, then went to the Mall and had dinner and did some shopping. We spent all day Saturday sightseeing (Marlowe is in a great location by the way close to the T, best way to get around Boston and if you don't like that, they always have cabs ready and waiting for you!) and spent Sunday snowed in, snowed in at the most romantic hotel ever. We had dinner at the restaurant that was great, we enjoyed the wine hour that is great. And by the way, I forgot tooth paste...and five minutes after I called, it was at my door. 5 star service all the way! Cannot wait to return this summer! Go Red Sox!

We stayed at the Marlowe for the blizzard of '06 so we spent a little more time in our room than anticipated. The staff was generally very helpful and the room was very comfortable, but we did have some misses by the hotel.
reviews.title: Good value but some maintinance problems
Dog owners - Best hotel experience ever!
reviews.text: The shower head in the room was leaking water out the side. I reached up to adjust it and it came off in my hand. Being a bit handy I managed to screw it back on and it didn't leak anymore.

reviews.title: Love Hotel Marlowe!!!
reviews.text: They advertise a service where they will deliver to your room any items that you forgot to pack. On the list was "tweezers" so we called down for some. They never appeared.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text: The bedside phone is of the wireless variety. Ours was of the non-functional wireless variety. There was however a second phone on the desk in the room and another in the bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Marlowe for the first time last week. The hotel is unique and fun, and the staff is very friendly. Our room was extremely quiet and comfortable. Overall, the hotel is a great value and an interesting place to stay. Our only compliants were with the front desk operation. The people were very pleasant to deal with, but it's hard to imagine why we couldn't get a copy of our bill at checkout, or why they couldn't break a five dollar bill for tip money. Come on guys! Bottom line - stay at the Marlow but bring your own ones!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Front Desk needs some work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed four nights at the Hotel Marlowe and just had an excellent experience. From the time we checked in till we left, everything was perfect. The staff are helpful, friendly and informative.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comparable to rooms at Bellagio in Vegas. The decor is new, comfortable and up to date.
reviews.title: Just got back and loved it!!

reviews.text: This is a boutique Hotel so not too big or busy. A great location outside of the city and very easy to get to. Cab ride over the bridge to anywhere in the city is about $10.00. We took the trolley 2 days and caught it right across the street from the Hotel.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: This Hotel is attached to the Galleria Mall - you don't even have to go outside. Great stores. You can catch a boatcruise along the river right from the mall. Any questions or if I can help email me at jamie-home@sympatico.ca.
reviews.title: The only place I'll stay in Boston

reviews.text: Hotel - really nice, unusual design. Nice restaurant.
reviews.title: Matched all expectations - and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - stylish and very comfortable
reviews.title: Love the Marlowe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - excellent. Nothing too much trouble
reviews.title: Sophistication

reviews.text: Location - this is the only (small) downside. Its in Cambridge but actually its a shorter walk (15-20 minutes) to central Boston than the main Cambridge area. Hotel is by a main road but also the river which is nice. Cab is $7-10 into central Boston and there is a local train nearby. I would have preferred to be in more central Boston but this would not put me off in the future.
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value - fantastic
reviews.title: You can't go wrong with the Hotel Marlowe!

reviews.text: We were bumped from our first hotel. My daughter and I had spent the insanely-hot day on her campus and were completely drained. Upon arrival we received a warm greeting. They invited us to join the Free Kimpton club which entitled us to free goodies in our mini-bar. There was also a wine tasting and appetizers set up in the lobby and we each had a sumptious cold white sangria. The room was immaculate and cozy, bedding was glorious. The bathroom was fantastic, stocked with everything we needed; but just in case, Marlow provides essentials, toothbrushes, etc for FREE! The desk clerk recommended several dinner restaurants and the one we chose was superb! Breakfast the next morning in the hotel cafe was devine, and rather reasonable.
reviews.title: Wanted to move in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: chose this spot basically for fido. They got great accommodation for my pooch and human as well.
reviews.title: great for fido!

reviews.text: parking can be a pain.no on site parking, gotta park at the mall for $20/day. One of the cheapest in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent ,Excellent, Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room is well appointed and luxurious!
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel!!

reviews.text: would recommend!
reviews.title: wonderful experience
Marlowe's at the Hotel Marlowe
reviews.text: While planning our trip out to New England, my fiance came across the Hotel Marlowe. His last name being Marlowe, he was sold on staying here for our one night in Boston. Yes, the Hotel is in Cambridge, but a short, cheap cab ride to Boston is worth the stay. The service was wonderful. Everyone was very helpful and attentive. The room was very nice, with a great view. See pic. I loved how comfy the bed was. One of the nicest surprises was the fact that the hotel is connected to a mall. Additional great facts about the Hotel Marlowe is their hosted happy hour and they are a dog friendly hotel. Welcoming each dog with their name listed at the front door and a doggy bowl of food and water.

reviews.title: A great weekend trip
reviews.text: We'll hopefully be able to stay at the Hotel Marlowe again, and will for sure if we find ourselves in that area.

reviews.title: Terrific visit
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Marlowe 2 weeks ago and we had a great time. I stayed with a friend of mine who moved to New Hampshire, but we wanted to hang out in the city. This hotel is really uniquely decorated and in a very convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of it being so close to the T and I actually took it to/from the airport to save money.
reviews.title: Great Night at the Marlowe

likes.liked: — Take the T or bus wherever you have to go.

reviews.text: The free wine happy hour was a great touch and so was the free coffee in the morning.
reviews.title: Delicious, Superb

reviews.text: My husband & I travelled to Boston from Australia for a business trip and stayed at the Hotel Marlowe. We were only in Boston for 5 days before returning home to Australia, and we were very impressed with the Hotel.
reviews.title: Thoroughly delighted with the Marlowe

likes.disliked: — no telephone directory in the room

reviews.title: Hotel Marlowe is wonderful!
reviews.text: From check-in to check out , and everything in between, we had no hassles or complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially Keith and his restaurant recommendations. The rooms were very clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable, which is super important when one is making 2 x 30hour flights in 1 week!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were wonderful, which made the stay very pleasant. We would not hesitate to stay here again. Well worth it.
reviews.title: Great stay if you need to be in Cambridge

reviews.text: This was my fifth stay at the Hotel Marlowe and, though I live approximately 25 minutes away from the hotel, it once again provided me with a much-needed mini vacation. From the adorable leopard-print robes to the 'Baby Bear' beds (they're "juuuuuuuuust right!" ;-), everything about my stay was a treat. I want to particularly commend Shelly at the front desk and concierges Keith and Justin (ask Justin about the meteorologist who stalked him as a kid!) for all of their help and generally all-around friendly demeanors. They make me feel like I'm coming home!
reviews.title: Greatly Dissapointed

likes.disliked: — unresponsive staff (room cold dispite several requests to fix heater)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marlowe for 4 nights last summer. I do not recommend staying here if you want to see the sights in Boston even though the hotel is cheaper than comparable Boston hotels. We should have stayed in Boston and made the commute to Cambridge when we needed to be there instead of actually staying in Cambridge.
reviews.title: We loved it!

likes.disliked: — Check in (although it wasn't that bad)

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Marlowe in August. Everything was first rate. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. The room was gorgeous. The rate was very reasonable for such a fine hotel. Be sure to sign up for InTouch -- they'll give you a credit for free snacks from the in-room snack bar. This was my first time at a boutique hotel. It won't be my last. I will go out of my way to find a Kimpton hotel when I travel. Every one is different, but all deliver world class service.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel. Treated like royalty. We have never experienced such terrific service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. Tell them you are a Kimpton member and you get free food from the room fridge. We checked in before noon and no one batted an eye. This is a dog friendly hotel with a chalk board listing the names of dogs currently staying there. We only saw one dog, but it's a cute idea anyway. They do have "dog free" floors. There is a wine hour, free coffee in the morning, Arnold Palmer's in the afternoon and no angry faces. All in all, a good visit at a very good price. Try for half the advertised room price. Kimpton will honor any travel web site price. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.
reviews.title: Far better than some of these reviews give credit

reviews.text: From the valet to the front desk the service was incredible. Everyone working at the hotel was amazingly accomodating. Free wine hour in the evening and coffee in the morning. They have 3 kayaks that are available free first come first serve which was a great feature that we took advantage of in the morning. The room was very nice and extremely quiet. Location is fantastic for visiting Harvard Square but would be a long walk. Overall fantastic place to stay in Boston.
reviews.title: Exceeded every expectation!

reviews.text: A great stay - staff is great, rooms are quiet and roomy, great amenities, great pillows and mini bar options. Kimpton Hotels in general are well run and this is no exception. Had no issues with location as was where I needed to be for work.
reviews.title: Excellent spot

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Marlowe in Boston/Cambridge. From before we even arrived, we were contacted by Dana Friedman, who offered us wonderful help. When we checked in both Dana and her colleague, Nick Salazar, were extremely friendly and helped us with wonderful advice. Thanks, also, to Ryan the front desk manager, who helped us on our last day. My two kids were treated so nicely and welcoming - it really made a difference for our trip off great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!!!!!

reviews.text: Great rooms - get the corner suite - worth the money for the river view and size. Comfortable bed, super ammenities, and it was quiet. Breakfast is wonderful and plentiful. You are a moderate walk to the T. Complaint is the restaurant menu is dissapointing - doesn't match the Kimpton image. You'l need the T or a cab unless you are a walker to cross the river to Boston or to Central Square. Many families when we stayed, at least 1 wedding and pet friendly. Staff and service are excellent.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: My husband and I have had two stays at this hotel in November which we booked on the Trip Advisor review rating. On the whole we had a good experience at this hotel and would certainly stay there again if we were in the area. I had stayed at the Royal Sonesta opposite the week before and definitely prefer the Marlowe.
reviews.title: Good hotel with a few reservations

likes.liked: — Free wine every evening between 5 and 6 coupled with excellent business facilities

reviews.text: There are two T stations near - one at the back of the mall, just 5 mins away and another 15 mins walk. The taxi rip-off problem is endemic to Cambridge because of bylaw regulations not just this hotel.
reviews.title: A gorgeous and exquisite Hotel

likes.liked: — Super comfortable bed and cozy down comforter

reviews.title: Agree with dont beleive the Hype
reviews.text: Positives: free wireless internet in the rooms, free wine tasting every evening which is very popular as the tastings are very generous! Excellent free business center with printer, very friendly staff who found us an extra light for desk quickly and coffee-making machine instantly. Fast frequently lifts. Handy for the mall for basic shopping and a good variety of basic eating places. Close to the Museum of Science.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disappointments: The breakfast is expensive and dull. As another reviewer said, why buy coffee when it's served free in the lobby? Food not nearly as interesting as they make out and restaurant service not nearly as good as front desk service.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: There are lots of glowing reviews for the Marlowe here. I was here for a business trip, my wife went with me.
reviews.title: Bad service, don't believe the hype

likes.disliked: — Bad service, small rooms, no comp. breakfast

reviews.text: Checkin took forever, and from the pictures on their website and the reviews here I was expecting a fabulous room and view. Our room was small, with only a view of the inner courtyard (so nothing basically).
reviews.title: An oasis of relaxation

reviews.text: No complementary breakfast. $4 for a muffin? That's reasonable. $3 for coffee? Step outside in the lobby, it's free. Then they messed up our order! Couldn't get their attention at all, had to stand up and ask for coffee and bring the bill to the desk.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back

likes.disliked: — Leave car parked and use taxis in Boston.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to see sites, this isn't the best location (I'm not a local, but it wasn't easy for us). The T is maybe a 20 minute walk. The hotel is attached to some mini mall if you want to shop, which is nice I guess.
reviews.title: Wonderful find in Cambridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The doormen have some kind of racket going on with the taxi cabs here. They all seemed to know them, and would not give printed receipts, only "Fill it yourself" receipts. I got ripped off twice, getting drove around to odd places and odd routes. I said "Downtown, Financial District" then the guy tries to drop us in Back Bay? Riiight...
reviews.title: Hotel Marlowe - Wonderful Place to Stay!
The Pits
reviews.text: Terrible location, pretentious decor and attitude, ridiculously high prices. I'd rather sleep on a park bench.

reviews.title: Watch out for Misinformation from Reservationists!
reviews.text: All looks, no substance! How can you have no fan or window in the bath? Ever try to put makeup on in front of a steamed up mirror that won't clear up? The reservationists all say they're right near the Lechmere subway stop but forget to mention that that subway stop has been closed for 7 months- not convenient to those of us from NYC who don't drive. NEVER AGAIN! Too far off the beaten track. Who wants to take a bus lugging suitcases to get to their hotel while on vacation?

reviews.title: Fab hotel location and restaurant
reviews.text: Just got back from Labor Day weekend at the Hotel Marlowe and we had a lovely three nights there. The rooms are sumptuously decorated and have a desk and easy chair. The bath amentities are all Aveda, the robes are plush faux animal fur and there is a regular hair dryer and an umbrella in the closet - as well as a safe. The bed linens are really very nice with a faux mink throw and lots of plush pillows. In addition to the TV there is a CD stereo player and high-speed internet access. The hotel restaurant is exceptional - (my Boston sister-in-law said it received rave reviews in the papers) and it's where room service originates. My husband and I had something from the appetizer menu (usually 2-3 different dishes) every single night and they were first rate. Good drinks, too. The hotel is connected to a large mall (very convenient) with a really nice food court (Au Bon Panne, etc, etc.) and a beautiful outside patio area by a large pond and fountain. Boat rides leave from this area for rides on the Charles - highly recommended. Absolutely ask for a room with a view of the Charles and Boston at night!

My husband and I stayed at the Marlowe for two nights last weekend. The staff are attentive and friendly, the room was very clean, comfortable AND pretty, the bathroom has Aveda products and a shaving/makeup mirror (yay!), and it was within walking distance of the financial district and the Back Bay. We walked to the Aquarium, to Quincy Market for lunch and then on to Newbury Street for some shopping. I absolutely recommend staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Pleasant stay at the Marlowe...
reviews.text: Just returned from a three night stay at Marlowe. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. We stayed in a king deluxe room, which I found a bit small - would spring for a suite next time, but the decor was a welcome difference from the standard traditions other hotels offer.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of December / beginning of January. The rooms are plush with down comforters, a faux fur blanket, velvet chairs and jungle print carpet and robes. The amenties are higher end Aveda products. This hotel is relatively quiet (noise doesn't travel from room-to-room). The in-room jazz CD was nice to listen to and the in-room fridge is completely stocked, not just with alcohol, but juices, soda, snacks, and with extra room to hold leftovers from the nearby Cheesecake Factory. Bambera, the Hotel Marlowe's award-winning restaurant, serves delicious food, elegantly presented, at dinner, and great breakfasts from the menu. The weekend buffet's quality left something to be desired--the potatoes were dried out and the eggs seemed chalky. But my omelet on a different morning (made to order) was one of the best I have ever eaten. The complimentary tea and coffee service in the mornings and the afternoon cocktail hour just add to the "little extras" this wonderful hotel provides. ALl of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We'd stay there again any time we are in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for New Year's Eve and Anytime

reviews.text: The Hotel Marlowe is a great hotel on the Cambridge side of the Charles River. Its a modern and stylish hotel that is an excellent alternative to the more expensive hotels in downtown Boston. Booking directly through the hotels site, we received an excellent luxurious room with a king size bed and a gorgeous view of the river and downtown Boston for $150/night. The closest T stop re-opened a few days before we arrived and so it was very convenient to get anywhere in Boston. We had a great time and the next time we stay in Boston, it will definately be at the Marlowe
reviews.title: Classy, stylish hotel with a great value

reviews.text: Reviews are right - this is a great place to stay. My room was lovely and clean, furniture was new and well cared for. Very clean bathroom with Aveda amenities. I really loved the wine hour and there were free shrimp one evening.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: My only real complaint was the hot water was out on Saturday morning but this was floor-wide. Room service food was cold and they forgot the bacon so I got comped.
reviews.title: Near Museum of Science
Great rooms and service!
reviews.text: Agreeable, friendly staff, housekeeping, well cared for premises. More than a 4 star I think - like 4.25 or so. You can tell they really want you to enjoy your stay. I've stayed at other chain hotels in the area (Sonesta, Holiday Inn) where there is no personal attention. This was very different and for the same price. Also, the Lechmere train station has reopened again. It's right behind the hotel bldg. complex, if you don't want to walk to the Museum of Science stop.

I stayed at this hotel for one night with my boyfriend. We chose this hotel because it is walking distance from the TD Banknorth Arena and across from the Museum of Science. This hotel is above and beyond anywhere else. It is beautifully designed. The staff is incredible! Very attentive and friendly. Room service twice a day, leopard print robes, a romantic sountrack on the cd player, first class bathroom soaps, direct access to the Galleria mall. There is not enough I can say about this BEAUITFUL hotel. Can not WAIT to go back.
reviews.title: Simply Perfection!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a romantic weekend to celebrate Valentine's Day in February and had a FABULOUS stay! I travel a lot for work and have stayed at many fine hotels but this one beats them all. The decor in the bedroom and throughout the hotel lobby are dazzling and very tasteful. The bed was very comfortable and elegant. What I loved most were the bathrobes the hotel offered guests. It's quite roomy with a nice sitting area for a laptop and to do some minor work but it's a place where you immediately forget you have work to do when you stay. It's so wonderful you may never leave it to go sightseeing! We were tempted to just stay in and enjoy our wonderful room. I highly recommend it for a romantic weekend getaway and you can get it at a great price at quickbook.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever!
Great Hotel, great room, -- Reservation service lacking
reviews.text: After difficulty getting email confirmation of our reservation at the special internet offer listed on the hotel's website, I was pleased to find our room was quiet and comfy with pillow-top beds and feather pillows, unique decor and a nice view. The restaurant breakfast buffet fueled us for a day of museums. It's a 5 minute walk to the Lechmere T station (end of the Green line) which provides direct route to the Boston Museum of Fine Arts & Gardener Musuem in about 20 minutes. I will stay here again and recommend to friends. The Thai restaurant nearby on 1st Street -- front desk staff can direct you -- is outstanding and reasonably priced.
This is probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in! I walked into the room and was just blown away by how nice, warm, inviting and just overall beautiful it was!
reviews.title: love love loved it

reviews.text: The rooms are awesome, and exactly as they appear in the photos posted here. Chushy comfy bed, fluffy pillows and down comforter, creative interior decorating, free high speed internet, leopard print robes, beautiful and well appointed overall with clear attention to detail, and the restaurant/bar is neat too which is an added plus.
reviews.title: One of the best in Boston/Cambridge

reviews.text: I visited this hotel with dogs and was welcomed with open arms. The room had a dog bed, bowls and treats waiting when we arrived. Excellent friendly service at all times from front desk, doorman, valet parking officials, cleaning staff. Hotel offers a wine/social hour and tea/coffee in the lobby every morning (dogs welcome). This hotel is right beside a beautiful park connected to multiple walking and jogging paths. A must visit hotel if traveling with pets. Super clean, no pet smell and dogs are not limited to just one floor of the hotel.
reviews.title: HOTEL LOVES DOGS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Marlowe mid evening, having just missed the complimentary wine hour but were immediatley given a voucher each for a glass of wine - what a nice start. We arived at our room to find that we had been upgraded to a fabulous river view and I would definatley choose this type of room again. The bed was really comfy nd the room really nicely decorated and relaxing. Throughout our stay all of the front desk staff and door men were incredibly helpful and very knowledgable about the area. The hotel has bikes and helmets available for your use and we cycled off to Harvard for the day - best way to get around in Cambridge.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: The Hotel is apx 5 mins walk to the Science Park T station and departure point for the Duck tours. To walk to Fanueil Hall is apx 25 mins but felt quite safe at night. To walk to Beacon Hill is again around half an hour.
reviews.title: Three nights of fun...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next door to the hotel is the Galleria Mall which has a couple of restaurants and plenty of shops. From the back of the Mall you can do a Charles River Boat Trip.
reviews.title: Great Staff! Great Food! Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there was anything that let the Marlowe down it is the Bambara Restaurant. Whilst the evening food is very nice, it is a little pricy and the breakfast is just awful. The service could also be much better - not very attentive.
reviews.title: Amazing experience, from the food to the accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking for a great hotel that's upscale, pet friendly, very convenient to Boston and offers complementary coffee/tea/wine and beer? Then look no further!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, views and pet friendly

likes.liked: — Luxury accomodations and pet friendly all in 1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me tell you that this was my first trip to Boston and we originally were going to stay in the city until we came across this hotel and decided to bring our 60 pound dog with us. We were celebrating our 5th wedding anniv., so I wanted a nice hotel with a view of the river and skyline that wasn't too expensive.
reviews.title: Amazing Customer Care!!!!!

reviews.text: **Tip-search online for the cheapest room price and Hotel Marlowe will match it. Self parking was $20 a day but on Sunday we did see plenty of spots in front of the Sonesta which looked nice as well. *FYI-the Sonesta has tourist info brochures in their lobby.
reviews.title: Classy Marlowe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving, I knew we made the right choice. Dog bones and a water bowl were at the entrance upon entering, the living room is the first thing you see and what a site, very cozy and elegant. Front desk was very friendly and helpful. The room was decorated with great fabrics and very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor and it had a great view. Loved everything!
reviews.title: Dog and People Friendly

likes.liked: — fun decor, dog friendly, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, there is limited space to put your clothes away and the lighting was dim in the bathroom but other than that it's perfect. Also, the hair dryer was located in the closet in a bag.
reviews.title: quite impressed

reviews.text: Part of the Kimpton chain, Hotel Marlowe lives up the the overall reputation of being a very hip hotel with super-cool decor and great service. Upon arrival I got a glass of wine in the lounge area (designed to be more like a big, cozy living room than a lobby area) and wonderful jazz music when entering the room. The rooms was larger than average (compared to Marriott or Westin in similar price ranges), very clean, and decorated in a hip, modern fashion. Very cool.
reviews.title: Hip Hotel Marlowe

reviews.text: The only downside is the location; while Cambridge is a great town, this is not in the heart of it but it is near the Charles river and Boston is a short taxi ride across it.
reviews.title: Chic boutique hotel in Cambridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flew to Boston for one day trip and was extremely fortunate to stay at the Hotel Marlowe. What a delight to not stay in a cookie cutter hotel. The designer of this hotel had some fun as you can see from the photos. Had a room facing the courtyard and as I can see from the other reviews, I lucked out because it was extremely quiet. Front desk staff was extremely helpful and efficient. Very centrally located to a plethora of Cambridge restaurants and Kendall Square (10 minute walk).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel Marlowe

reviews.text: A beautiful hotel in a great location. The staff was wonderful, room was perfect.
reviews.title: A Gem for visiting Boston

reviews.text: We had come to Boston for a long weekend with another couple and had booked a B&B in Beacon Hill on Brimmer St. (yes, the exclusive area) that was so unacceptable we called around area hotels to find rooms at 10 pm. We found Hotel Marlowe by chance. 10 minutes from Boston. What an unexpected pleasure, from the friendly staff to the colorful fun decor, (clean and inviting) rooms. Bathrooms were spotless. A drawer in the TV cabinet held amenities that were well thought out for travelers. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel. Not a typical chain and it shows.
reviews.title: Loved Marlowe

description: The wonderfully eclectic and luxurious Hotel Marlowe is perfectly situated minutes from Harvard Square and the MIT campus in Cambridge. The waterfront location offers guestroom views of the park-lined Charles River and Boston skyline. This unique boutique hotel, a Kimpton Hotel, further sets itself apart with unsurpassed service, superb amenities and educational and cultural programs. It celebrates and reflects the vibrant sense of discovery that is quintessential Cambridge. Adjacent is the award-winning Bambara restaurant.
